snippet.title: The Reason We Learn
snippet.description:
This channel is where I hope to shine a light on, and speak out against the insidious ways political activists are dominating education in America right now. I'm a former teacher and mother of three, with an MSed in Elementary Education from UPENN. I left public school teaching in 1992 after only two years because I could not abide the prevailing view amongst my colleagues and superiors that "individualism" is "selfish" and "dangerous." I couldn't beat them using reasoned arguments, and I didn't want to join them in the land of unreason, so I left, hoping parents and cultural leaders would wake up, and correct this trend in due time. Turns out I hoped in vain. 

I believe the illiberalism dominating our schools, and our culture today, poses an existential threat to our freedom, our civil rights, and our republic. If you agree, I hope you'll subscribe.

channel.keywords: education teaching reason "ayn rand" objectivism individualism k-12 "social justice" politics k12indoctrination schoolchoice homeschooling freedomofspeech "john taylor gatto" "critical race theory" wokism "teachers unions" "self directed education" "virtual learning"
